titlestmt.titleproper: Kenneth M. MacKenzie papers, 1950 and mostly late 1900s
titlestmt.author: David Hill

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by David Hill using EADitor ©2011

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Research, reference materials, and items prepared for publication on the topic of Ottoman numismatics.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The papers were donated to the ANS by Kenneth MacKenzie's wife Jean after his death in 2005.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The papers were produced and used by Kenneth MacKenzie until his death in 2005.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Kenneth M. MacKenzie papers, 1950 and mostly late 1900s, Archives, American Numismatic Society.

userestrict.head: Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright restrictions may apply. Permission to publish or reproduce must be secured from the American Numismatic Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Contains MacKenzie’s research, reference materials, and items prepared for publication on the topic of Ottoman numismatics, including work on the book Countermarks of the Ottoman Empire (1974). There are notes, photographs of coins, articles, clippings, drawings, publication offprints, and coin lists. Most of the materials are in folders or cut and pasted into notebooks. In addition, there are clippings from a variety of Great Britain newspapers on the topic of coins generally which were cut and pasted onto cards by a clipping service (1950).
